ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol). Makes me feel better after talking over my worries with him/her
Notes: 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

ElementDescription: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Smiles at me very often.
Notes: 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

ElementDescription: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Is able to make me feel better when I am upset.
Notes: 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

ElementDescription: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Believes in showing his/her love for me.
Notes: 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

ElementDescription: First caregiver (caregiver participating in study/completing protocol).  Is easy to talk to.
Notes: 1 = Not like him/her; 2 = Somewhat like him/her; 3 = A lot like him/her

ElementDescription: Is there a second adult who cares for you, that you spend a significant amount of time with, like your other parent, step-parent, grandparent, aunt or uncle?
Who is the second caregiver? If more than one caregiver, choose the person you spend the most time with.
Notes: 1 = mother; 2 = father; 3 = grandmother; 4 = grandfather; 5 = aunt; 6 = uncle; 7 = other

ElementDescription: Makes me feel better after talking over my worries with them.
Notes: 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

ElementDescription: Second caregiver. Smiles at me very often.
Notes: 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

ElementDescription: Second caregiver. Is able to make me feel better when I am upset.
Notes: 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

ElementDescription: Believes in showing their love for me.
Notes: 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

ElementDescription: Second caregiver. Is easy to talk to.
Notes: 1=Not like them ; 2=Somewhat like them ; 3=A lot like them

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
Who is the caregiver that is participating in the study with you today?
Notes: 1 = mother; 2 = father; 3 = grandmother; 4 = grandfather; 5 = aunt; 6 = uncle; 7 = other

ElementDescription: Time Point
